turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Mace... no disrespect... but you run this on the 11 o'clock news, by midnight you got the biggest riot in history.  They'll see the fucking smoke from Canada.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay... what about Strickland?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No.  Bad idea.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He's got her up in the room, under guard.  And he's still working the party... acting smooth like nothin's nothin'.  So buddy... I say we work a trade.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Give him the tape.  See?  It's fucking brilliant!  The tape for Faith.  I know he'll go for it.  I can set it up.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: This is what we laughingly refer to as a plan, right?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Come on!  If he gives us any shit, we kill 'em all.  Whattya say?  Just get your butt down here.  If I'm not at the shindig downstairs go to the room.  It's 2203.  You writin'?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: 2-2-0-3.  Got it.  Stay on her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I intend to.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No.  I suppose not.  I didn't know you were colorblind, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Only way I could stand your ties.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'll have that.  Glock 22.  Nice.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Where's Faith?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I sent her to the party.  I figured I'd wait up here until you killed Tran.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What makes you think I'm gonna kill Tran?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You just did.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know, statistically that's the second most common word people say right before they die.  Shit being number one.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So... I killed Tran.  Then you ran in, being on his payroll, and shot me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's pretty much the way it happened.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Now I'm remembering. I killed Iris too, didn't I?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's right.  They'll find the original of her snuff clip in your apartment.  The one I left for you at the club was a copy.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Was I a really busy guy?  Did I do Tick too?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You bet.  Did you like it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Picture it... I feel like I gotta share this with somebody.  It's too perfect.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I won't say anything.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know.  So, I'm working for this puke, right?  And he says he'll pay me quite large to do the hooker. But also I gotta do his bitch girlfriend cause she knows the whole score and she's totally out of control.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Only he doesn't know about me and Faith.  So I say to myself, if I turn the job down, he just gets somebody else.  And I lose Faith... to coin a phrase.  So to buy time, I do the skank.  I still gotta do something about Tran... I figure it's him or me... but I can't cap him without a chump to take the fall.  And who better than his girlfriend's loser ex-boyfriend... a known criminal... who has been seen hassling them in public numerous times.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: And who was, regrettably, also your best fucking friend.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No plan is perfect, Lenny.  Hey, cheer up.  World's gonna end in ten minutes anyway.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You must be so pleased, I followed your jellybean trail right here, like a good little chump.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You got froggy on me a couple times.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So there never was a death squad.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Naawww.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Just those two loose-cannon cops running around covering their butts.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  Pretty zany, huh?  All this shit caused by a random traffic stop.  Hey... nothing means nothing. You know that.  Look around... the whole planet's in total chaos.  You gotta take what you can, while you can.  Cause some shitbird can come up and put a fuckin' .22 in the back a your head any second.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: How did you hook up with Faith?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This dink hires me a month ago to eyeball her, right?  But Faith knows me from you, right, so she comes up to me and says, 'Hey Max why you following me?' I say, 'I'll buy you a drink and explain.' And she says...

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Don't have a fucking coronary, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Well you could've at least warned me.  You know I hate the zap... when they die.  It just brings down your whole day.  Jeez, Tick.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: How'd you get the tape?  Why didn't the cops put it in evidence?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: With all the blood I guess they didn't see the rig.  Guy had it under a wig.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, but how'd it get to you?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: I got ways, Lenny, I got ways.  Okay, okay... I got a deal with some a the paramedics.  My guy pages me and I pick it up at the morgue.  So whaddya think?  This clip's gotta be worth at least a grand.  Right?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Tick.  Not to dash your hopes, but I don't deal this kind of product, you know that.  I'll give you four for it, cause I've gotta cut off the last bit.  And my customers want uncut.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Fuck that!  The last part's the best.  You dry-dive six stories and blammo!  Jack right into the Big Black.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I don't deal black-jack clips!  It's policy.  I got ethics here.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Yeah, when did that start?  Come on, man!  It's what people want to see, and you know it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So lay it off to somebody else.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Come on, Lenny.  I got expenses.  I got to get this rig fixed.  Look at it...

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Give me six at least.  This's a good clip, here.  Gets you pumpin'.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, well, the first part's okay. Better than the usual soaps you bring me.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Now that is cold, Lenny.  I always bring you choice.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Sure, like this low-grade shit here, some girl in a fight with her boyfriend... it's a test-pattern. Nothing happens.  I'm snorin'.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Hey, you're always saying, 'Bring me real life.  Bring me street life. And, like, one man's mundane and desperate existence is another man's Technicolor.'

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I said that?  Look, I'll take it for five, and you'll make out okay, because in this case it's pure cream, you don't have to cut anything back to the wearer.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Ha!  That's for fucking sure.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What else you got?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Whoa.  That is one unbelievable piece of eyefuck.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Skip the art criticism, Tick, what can you tell me about the wearer.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Well... the guy's fucked up.

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Lookit, you see the peak period ratios there?  Could be some kind of tumor or brain lesion or something. Some kind of trauma  This is not good.  I don't like this at all...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Well, it's cutting awful close to me.  I mean she was just here.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Who was just here?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Iris, man.  Pay attention.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Wait, wait... wait a minute.  Iris was here?!

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: Yeah, she came by last night. Shaking like a junkie, wanting me to make a copy of some clip.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What clip?  What was it?

turns.speaker: TICK
turns.text: I don't know, man, she wouldn't let me see it.  Said I wouldn't want to see it.  She said she was going to give it to you to hold for her. Like insurance or somethin'

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She never gave me a tape.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: You come to peddle me some tapes, Lenny?  For old time's sake?  Make a couple bucks for the holidays?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You're not a client anymore, Tran. I wouldn't sell you the sweat off a dead dog's balls.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: I already got everything I need from you.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Show a little respect, Nero.  The man was an important artist.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, important for your label. Which no doubt is why you're in mourning.  Don't worry, his records'll sell out now he's dead. You'll make out.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: I always do.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Faith, can I talk to you a second?

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: That would be between me and Faith, wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Charm.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: Uh huh.  Look, Nero.  I'll make you an offer.  Take her.  Right now.  If she wants to go, if she's unhappy here, she can go.  I'll let her choose.  Faith always knows what she wants.  Hands off.  See?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's alright.  He means it.

turns.speaker: TRAN
turns.text: I do mean it.  And I mean this... if Faith stays you go away and never come back. You scuttle back into your cockroach hole and never cross my vision again.  You understand?

turns.speaker: STRICKLAND
turns.text: Nero.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Strickland.

turns.speaker: STRICKLAND
turns.text: Commissioner Strickland.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Sure.  Whatever.  See, since you shitcanned my career, I don't even have to call you sir.  One of life's small pleasures.

turns.speaker: STRICKLAND
turns.text: Aren't you peddling your wares a little far from your usual gutter?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I was invited here by a close friend, Mr. Fumitsu, see he's right over there.

turns.speaker: STRICKLAND
turns.text: I don't like disappointments, Nero. And do you know what disappoints me very much?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Your sex life?

turns.speaker: STRICKLAND
turns.text: Your existence.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Greetings, gents.  So let's hear this week's sad story.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: They jerked my wheels, d'you believe it?  I mean it's outrageous, the computer errors the banks are making lately.  Have you noticed?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Thanks for giving me a ride.  I just have a few stops, mostly on the west side--

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.  I said I'd drop you home, but I'm not taking you on your sleazoid rounds.  I've already pulled twelve hours today.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Come on, Mace.  This is gonna be a big night.  Can't you feel it?  The energy in the air?  There's money to be made, dreams to sell.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Sleaze to peddle.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Just a couple of hours.  It'll be fun--

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Excuse me.  What part of NO don't you understand?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mace, you're my friend.  I need you. Plus I'll give you 25% of what I make tonight.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny, this may be a hard concept for you, but friends don't have to pay their friends.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Jeez, you're pathetic.  Okay, I got a pickup at the St. James.  I'll take you there, you can get a cab.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mace!  You're a life-saver.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Driving Mr. Lenny.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: So, what's up with you?  Another busy night selling porno to wireheads?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No, wrong... I sell experiences. Sex is only part of it.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Buncha techno-perv jerkoffs.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Way I look at it, I actually perform a humanitarian service.  I save lives.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Uh huh, I wanna hear this part.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay, take some executive... bored with his life, bored with his wife... he picks up a hooker or some girl at a bar.  Then he goes around for months, torn up worrying that he's got AIDS, that he'll infect his wife.  And maybe he really does catch something--

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Price he pays for being a scumsucking pig.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Everybody needs to take a walk to the dark end of the street sometime, it's what we are.  But now the risks are outa line.  The streets are a war zone.  And sex can kill you.  So you slip on the trodes, you get what you need and it keeps you from jumping your tracks.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny, this shit's illegal.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Define illegal.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Me bailing your sorry pale ass out of jail twice in the last six months.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, but that was for love.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Define love.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Fumitsu.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mr. Fumitsu, good evening sir, Leonard Nero, Security Express. Lornette Mason here is just completing our routine driver evaluation.  We do it to make sure that out VIP clients, such as yourself, are always treated as honored guests.  I just need to ride up front and take some notes, if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Coming with you.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You will not live to see the morning.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Are we having a bad night?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Let's talk in the car.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hey, careful on the jacket.  This is Armani.  You angry?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I've had enough of this shit.  You're on foot, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: In LA?  Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I need my case.  It's still in the back.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Get it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: That would be no.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I've had it.  No more wirehead shit in my car.  You understand?  You want to poach your lobes, do it somewhere else.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay, you got my attention, but this is cutting off the circulation to my head, here.  D'you mind?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I thought we were friends.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No, see a friend is more than one person constantly doing favors for another.  You just suck people along with your schemes and your scams and your slick act.  Well I'm out.  I got a kid, I got rent, I got an ex- husband someplace who doesn't send me a dime of support... I'm just trying to hold on here.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So am I.  Just trying to get by.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No, you're just trying to get off.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Macey... I've never seen you like this.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny, you're turning into some kinda squid-head low-life.  You're always broke, you just go from one score to the next.  And you're getting strung out... you don't even see it.  Getting high on your own supply like some crack dealer.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I know you wouldn't be saying all this if you didn't care about me. Thanks, Mace.  Really.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Look, I gotta get some sleep.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You still like me, don't you?  We're still buddies?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah.  I don't see a way out of it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Macey, I know you're tired, but can you drop me at the Retinal Fetish? It's on your way.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Jesus, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Begging?  Groveling?  Any pathetic behavior at all?  Will that help? Faith's there tonight, and I've got to talk to her.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Sure, Lenny.  The only thing worse than a junkie is someone in love.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Who's the new side of beef in Tran's posse?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Guy named Wade Beemer.  Used to be a running back for the Rams in '96 and '97.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Rams... that's football, right?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Forget her.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She still loves me.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: She thinks you're a bucket of dog vomit.  Trust me on this.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She's my destiny.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Destiny?  You living in a perfume commercial?  She's a hard-climber that dropped you like a used tampon when she got a better ride.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You'll see.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You're some piece of work, you know that.  Just calmly backstroking around in the big toilet bowl, and somehow you never let it touch you. I mean, between Vice and this so- called occupation you're in now, you must've seen it all.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I have crawled through the gutter... through every wrinkle in the human brain.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What I'm saying.  But you still come out this goofball romantic.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It is my sword and my shield, Macey.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What's that?  Present from Faith?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No idea.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Go to the Sunset Sheraton.  RIGHT NOW!  Just go!  GO!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: My God, Lenny.  What is it?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Black.  Jack.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Blackjack?  I don't understand--

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Snuff clip.  It was Iris.  She said she needed my help and I... aw Jesus, Mace... the sick fucker killed her.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Are you sure it's real?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: And gives it to you.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Wants to share.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Cause you're the man, right?  The Magic Man.  If it's got something to do with the wire, sooner or later it washes up on your beach.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I've never dealt in black-jacks. Never.  Everybody knows that.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Jesus, Mace.  Back off.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: This guy is someone you know, one of your squid-head contacts.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Uh unh.  No way!  They'd crucify me.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: So some psycho wire-freak gets to keep running around--

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Is this great fabric or what?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You ever wonder why you get beat up a lot?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Never really thought about it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He knows what he's doing.  He's worn before... a lot.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: So that gives you something.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It gives me... I don't know... maybe two hundred people who I know wear.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Don't crank the gain any more. You're gonna fry yourself.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I need to see more... get more detail.  Something.  I feel his presence, so strong...

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No more, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm ghosting pretty bad.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She came to me for help.  I should have read it better... I just figured, y'know... another strung- out hooker having a bad night.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: It's not your fault.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: See, it's all about what they see walking in.  A dead hooker, handcuffs, penetration... they'll see a trick gone wrong.  Random kill.  The kind you never solve.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: But that doesn't add, does it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No it doesn't.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Because Iris knew somebody was after her.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She said "If they get me".  They. Which means the whole sex-killer thing is a cover, which means somebody whacked her for a reason.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: So the guy's not a sicko.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: If he could do what's on that tape, he's a sicko.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Okay, so he's a freak who thinks he's sane pretending to be a freak. The point is, he was a hitter. Somebody wanted to shut her up.  But why not just put a little lead in her ear?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Because it had to look random.  Not connected to anything or anyone.  But then why give the rape to me?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: That's where it gets a little strange.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: And what about the guy that was following me?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Now you're really getting paranoid.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: The question is not whether I am paranoid, but whether I am paranoid enough.  You want to rub my neck?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: How's Zander?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: OK.  He asks about you all the time. It's been weeks since you've seen him.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I'm sorry about getting on your case earlier.  I just see you getting sucked in deeper and deeper, and I -- anyway.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: S'okay.  I know you still love me.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Whatup Lenny?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Jesus, Mace!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Where we going?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Anywhere.  We'll talk about it in the car.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: This tie doesn't go with blue!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Will you relax.  There's nobody back there.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mace, the guy had a knife.  To my throat.  In my living room. Relaxing might be right out, okay?!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You better keep a low profile for a while.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No shit.  You got someplace in mind?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny, have you lost it completely?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Easy, there, Mom.  Easy.  This is audio only.  John Coltrane.  "A Love Supreme." Give it a listen, let me know what you think, maybe you won't go for it now, but it'll get in your head and grow like a seed into something really beautiful.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Think back about what she said. Exactly what she said.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: She wanted to go out to my car, something about my car...

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Something in your car...

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny, give them the tape.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's in my case.  Okay?  I'm going to open my case...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Take it easy.  The glass is bullet resistant.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Bullet resistant?  Whatever happened to bullet proof?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny.  Calm down.  This is what I do.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Goddamnit!!  911 is busy!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: It's okay, Lenny  They'd never get here in time anyway.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: This is bad.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: The gas tank's going to go any second!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Are you out of your fucking mind?!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Fire's out, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I can't believe we had to give them the damn tape.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, me neither.  It was one of my favorites.  Me and Faith in a hot tub on my birthday.  I'm going to really miss it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Those two guys were cops.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It's the walk.  Something.  Anyway, they'll run your plates and get your address.  We gotta keep moving.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I can't tell you.  You've got to see.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Uh unh.  I won't do it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mace.  I know what you think about the wire.  But I'm asking you to do this.  It's that important.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hang on.  Hang on, Max.  You see?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I see.  I see the earth opening up and swallowing us all.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah I know.  So what do we do?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: We got to make another copy of this. Little life insurance.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You know what this tape could do if it gets out.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I've got a good idea, yeah.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: People finding out... seeing... that the LAPD just flat out executed Jeriko One.  Jesus.  Maybe they ought to see.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Maybe.  But tonight is probably not the best night.  Come on, we're rollin'.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: So, let's see, I've got Tran's goons, some squidhead psycho and the LAPD all trying to kill me.  Happy new year, Lenny.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Well, look at the plus side.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: There's a plus side?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah.  You gave up your hot tub tape to save me.  That's real progress for you.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It was a tough call.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I still can't square the psycho smarts of whoever did Iris with those two cops.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I don't think those cops did Iris. I think whoever Iris was wearing for killed her.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: To break the trail.  If those cops had gotten hold of her, they would have beat it out of her who she was wearing for, and then gone after them too.  Our killer is running as scared as we are.  Which makes him really dangerous.  Judging by how scared I am.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He's totally cut off from the outer world.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: How long does it last?  Oh.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: The only card we have to play is the tape.  You know, we get it to the media somehow...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah, right, blow it open.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Who's Strickland?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Deputy Commissioner Palmer Strickland.  The sanctimonious prick who busted me out.  His ass is so tight when he farts only dogs can hear it.  I know this guy.  If there's one cop who's not dirty it's him.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Kinda guy you can count on in a pinch.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Why didn't he just go public with the tape?  Save himself that way.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Okay, we gotta get over there.  Can you borrow a dress from Cecile or something--

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I'm not going.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Whatya mean?  We're going!  Tran's gonna do her right there unless--

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Lenny... shutup.  Just park your mouth and listen.  It's a set-up. Think about it!  Why's he been sending you tapes?  To freak you, get you to rush in without thinking. Then they put one in you, put one in her, put the gun in your hand... crime of passion.  This guy's bent enough to think of that.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah.  Lenny.  I have.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: It didn't stop you from loving them. Right?  Or understanding them, or being able to forgive them...

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: And it didn't stop you from wanting to protect them.  Did it?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No.  It didn't.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I worked Vice, Narcotics... Violent Crimes... and I saw every known depravity.  I was lost, Mace.  In outer darkness.  Then I busted this strung-out little teeny-hooker. When I met Faith she was just another runaway giving twenty dollar blowjobs to buy crank.  Another lost soul.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: You never told me.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: But she was different.  There was a light in her eyes... and she had this voice.  It was scary, all that pain coming out of that little body. Like she could take all the hurt and rage of the entire world and lift it up to heaven in one voice.  I helped her.  And I promised her that I'd always be there... to protect her.  See?  It's not about what's in her head.  It's what's in mine.  I can't let go of the promise.  It's... like... it's all I have left.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No, it's not.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Mace... you're a girl.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Good, Lenny.  I can see why the detective gig didn't work out.  Come on.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Got your ticket?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No.  They must have sent it to my beach house by mistake.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You see Tran?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Uh unh.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Alright.  We're going up.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: And do what?  Take on his whole posse?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I still got one ace to play.  Tran's got what I want... and I've got what he wants...

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: That's the original.  There are no copies.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Exactly.  That's why it's a make- able deal.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Take it to him.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: A cop?  You want me to trust a cop?!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: No.  Trust me.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Oh boy.  What if you're wrong?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Then we'll be right where we are now.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Fucked.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Are we under arrest?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Naw.  They just have to ask us a few questions... for about six hours.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Hey, Lenny.  We made it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Yeah.  We did.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Well...  Get going.  You're still bleeding.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: See you downtown.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah.  See you there.

turns.speaker: ZANDER
turns.text: Where were you Mom?  Did you meet a guy?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Just Lenny.

turns.speaker: ZANDER
turns.text: Right.  That explains it.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Are you going to make me beg?

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ZANDER
turns.text: Cheerios and wieners.  I made it myself.  It's good.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Well give me some then... I'm starving.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: We're going to aunt Cecile's, honey. We're going to watch fireworks from there.  Let's go.  Chop chop.

turns.speaker: ZANDER
turns.text: Aw, Mom!

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: No.  I haven't noticed because I make my payments.  So, Max Pelcher, how's the P.I. business?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sucks.  Hey, Bobby, turn that up.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Hey, isn't that Tran Vo?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yup.  He was Jeriko's manager.  Bummer, Tran!  Lost your golden goose.  Couldn't happen to a nicer guy.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: But I mean isn't he Faith's new--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sssssh!  Not in front of Lenny.  You may trigger a maudlin display which will force us to tranquilize him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He's skull-fucking you, bud.  Trying to get a reaction.  Maybe pushing you to do something.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Maybe he just figures Lenny will appreciate what he's created.  It's the dark end of the street, Lenny. How do you like it now?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Problem is, Lenny knows everybody.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Take the tape to the cops.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Those two psycho cops are on a slash-and-burn to find the tape and cover their tracks.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: This seems a little sophisticated for them.  These are not subtle guys.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: There's more to this whole thing than you think.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: So you're saying we just pretend is didn't happen?  It happened!  The LAPD executed one of the most important black men in America!  Who the fuck are you to bury this?!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fine.  Do you want blood running waist deep in the storm drains?  The gangbangers'll spread like a wave through this city and burn it to the ground.  And when the fires start the street cops'll be capping off at anything that moves.  It'll be all- out war and you know it.

turns.speaker: MACE
turns.text: Yeah, well maybe it's time for a war!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You really want that on your head?
